scrape.title: The dinner
scrape.author: Trisha
scrape.text: “That’s the oppressive thing about happiness, the way everything is out on the table like an open book:” I'm very torn on this one and I can see why it's a good book to read as a book club or group. It's a book with a lot of things to talk about. What do you do when your child makes a horrible decision? You want to teach them and guide them but we need to let children make their own decisions in order to help them - especially as they get older. These boys are around 16 - old enough to hopefully be making better decisions but definitely still making mistakes.I was horrified by at least half of this book. I think with each new chapter, after midway, my mouth was permanently dropped open. It's just so staggering but I can easily see how this opinion is adopted. It's frightening.
